meanings.definition: In a way that shows offense or annoyance.
meanings.sent1: She umbrageously stomped away after being criticized.
meanings.sent2: He umbrageously folded his arms when his suggestion was ignored.
meanings.sent3: The cat umbrageously knocked over the vase in protest.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds gathered umbrageously, ready to unleash a storm.
meanings.sent5: The teacher umbrageously scolded the students for talking during the test.

meanings.definition: In a manner that is easily offended or irritated.
meanings.sent1: The child umbrageously pouted when told it was bedtime.
meanings.sent2: She umbrageously huffed at the slightest criticism.
meanings.sent3: The dog umbrageously refused to eat the new dog food.
meanings.sent4: The old house creaked umbrageously in the wind.
meanings.sent5: The customer umbrageously demanded to speak to the manager about the service.
